dataIdInfo.idAbs: This dataset represents polygon boundaries of all public water agencies in California including public water systems, agricultural water districts, urban water districts, Federal and State water contractors, wholesalers, retailers, and other public or private utilities that deliver water to the end user.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The purpose of the data is to assist the public in identifying Water Agencies in California. The associated data are considered DWR enterprise GIS data, which meet all appropriate requirements of the DWR Spatial Data Standards, specifically the DWR Spatial Data Standard version 2.0, dated October 20, 2015. DWR makes no warranties or guarantees—either expressed or implied—as to the completeness, accuracy, or correctness of the data, nor accepts or assumes any liability arising from or for any incorrect, incomplete or misleading subject data. The official DWR GIS Steward for this data set is Siran Erysian who may be contacted at (559) 230-3312. or at serysian@water.ca.gov. Comments, problems, improvements, updates, or suggestions should be forwarded to the official GIS Steward as available and appropriate.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: DWR: Northern Region, North Central Region, South Central Region, Southern Region. USBR

LegConsts.othConsts: The associated data are considered DWR enterprise GIS data, which meet all appropriate requirements of the DWR GIS Spatial Data Standards. DWR makes no warranties or guarantees, either expressed or implied, as to the completeness, accuracy or correctness of the data, nor accepts or assumes any liability arising from or for any incorrect, incomplete or misleading subject data.

Consts.useLimit: The associated data are considered DWR enterprise GIS data, which meet all appropriate requirements of the DWR GIS Spatial Data Standards. DWR makes no warranties or guarantees, either expressed or implied, as to the completeness, accuracy or correctness of the data, nor accepts or assumes any liability arising from or for any incorrect, incomplete or misleading subject data.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959
dataIdInfo.suppInfo: The original data were compiled for the Drought Emergency Declaration in 2014 from various sources including the U.S. Bureau of Reclamation, existing boundaries from DWR Northern Region Office, DWR North Central Region Office, DWR South Central Region Office, DWR Southern Region Office, boundaries submitted for agricultural water management plans and urban water management plans, and groundwater monitoring agencies. Many of the districts were formed based on DWR Bulletin 155-94 through General District Acts or Special District Acts. The California Department of Public Health public water system boundaries were obtained from the Department's Environmental Health Tracking Program Drinking Water Systems Geographic Reporting Tool where customer service area boundaries were identified and digitized. These data were compiled into a master list of water utilities for information needed during the 2014 California Drought. The boundaries were the best available data to date. The current dataset supersedes that dataset.

report.measDesc: Data was normalized for consistency of names in Microsoft Access database Organizations Master.accdb maintained by DWR. Each normalized agency where a boundary existed was included in the dataset. Spatial consistency does not apply to this dataset since the boundaries are compiled from parts of various datasets. Boundaries from the following organizations were included in the original dataset: Agricultural water management plans, Urban water management plans, California Department of Public Health water systems, water agency boundaries from Northern, North Central South Central and Southern Regions offices of DWR which include public water agencies, private water agencies, State Water Project Contractors, federal water contractors, Reclamation Districts, CASGEM monitoring entities, community service districts.

As of the writing of this metadata, the dataset is considered complete. Additional boundaries will be included when identified. Modifications to existing boundaries will take place when more accurate information is obtained from source.

Attribute accuracy was verified by sorting on each field to ensure no blank or null values were present. All features have an Agency Name, Agency Unique ID, ModifiedBy value. Exceptions: There are 166 records that have null values for LastModified Date field. There are 176 records that have null values for DateDataAppliesTo. Source Comments field may contain null values and remain empty until needed.
report.evalMethDesc: Most records were complete with values represented in all fields except for those listed above. Some records have not been identified for names. The “@” at the end of the name is included in the Agency Name field. A future effort will have to identify the names of these water utilities. Agency_Unique_ID, AgencyName: 845 Emmitt Dist. Imp. Co. @ 1182 Hilltop MWA @ 1604 Midland Dist. Imp. Co. @ 1828 P CANAL @USRB Source 2 (or pcanal) 1941 Plevna Dist. Imp. Co. @@ 1994

report.measDesc: Positional accuracy determined to be 215 meters horizontal accuracy at 95% confidence level, margin of error: 3%.
report.evalMethDesc: Positional accuracy tested using the Positional Accuracy assessment tool and Data Reviewer's sampling check number method where the subject dataset was compared to a reference dataset (NAIP 2014 imagery)using a subset of random points selected by the tool. A total of 20 points were selected resulting in a absolute circular error of 215 meters and a relative circular error of 333 meters.

prcStep.stepDesc: Spatial datasets identified in previous section(source contribution) were compiled to create a single spatial data set for water agency boundaries for the Emergency Water District dataset for informational needs during the 2014 Drought. This dataset was used as a baseline and modified if more accurate data was available. Individual districts or agencies were contacted if errors or more current data was identified and that data was obtained from the agency itself, LAFCO websites for various counties or other DWR programs that may have obtained program specific data Checking accuracy and continuing to obtain missing or updated data will be an ongoing process.

dataSource.srcDesc: Data were compiled from the following: DWR Northern, North Central, South Central, Southern Region offices, USBR federal, state and private water contractors, Public Water Supply Systems from California Department of Public Health, various water agencies in California who provided updated boundaries to the existing dataset. The data varied in accuracy and completeness.

overview.eaover: This dataset contains polygon features representing water agencies in California. Attributes include AgencyName, Source, AgencyUniqueID, LastModifiedDate, ModifiedBy, SourceComments, DateDataAppliesTo, GlobalID, ShapeArea, ShapeLength.
overview.eadetcit: Reference used: DWR Spatial Data Standards v2.0

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
